channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.description:
Report X-2024031030

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKER IN DOOR 27 OF THE UNLOAD. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED, HE PUT THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY, CLEANED RESIDUE, AND BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030696
item.description:
Report X-2024030696

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the drum in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The drum looks to be leaking due to many dents. The dents are located on the sides and both the top and bottom of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was put into a plastic spill bag and then into the hazmat cage in a black tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030362
item.description:
Report E-2024030362

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 12, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of adhesive were punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The crew then containerized the damaged pails in one (!) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023120064
item.description:
Report I-2023120064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: NELSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAU CLAIRE CO OPERATIVE OIL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tank vehicle was traveling 35 mph in a 55 mph zone, on a rural paved road. Driver was pealing a banana when the vehicle left the paved portion of the roadway, entered the soft fhoulder of the road, was pulled into the ditch and rolled. As time passed and the vehicle lay on its passenger side, diesel fuel began to trickel from the releif vents on the fill port covers. Approximately two gallons of fuel was released from the cargo tank of which approximately 2 cups reached the enviorment. Two shovels full of contaminated soil were removed from the scene and placed in a diesel fuel waste barrel for proper disposal.
